attrs.description: This attribute gives you the option to control animation in your charts. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the animation duration of the chart. `animationDuration` attribute is applicable only if animation of the chart is enabled. 

Default value: 1 sec
attrs.name: animationDuration

attrs.description:
Animates the plot in clockwise direction. 

Default value: 0
attrs.name: animateClockwise

attrs.description:
Instead of rotational animation, you can set alpha animation which displays your chart slowly from `0` alpha to `100`. 

Default value : 0
attrs.name: alphaAnimation

attrs.description: FusionCharts XT introduces the concept of Color Palettes. Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: While the `palette` attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (i.e., column, line, pie etc.). Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma e.g., `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
attrs.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma
attrs.name: paletteColors

attrs.description: Configuration whether to show pies with 0 values (and their values). Otherwise, they won't show up in the chart.
attrs.name: showZeroPies

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage values in labels of the chart.
attrs.name: showPercentValues

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage values in tool tip.
attrs.name: showPercentInToolTip

attrs.description: Whether to show labels on the chart.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: Whether to show values on the chart.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: The character to separate the data label and data values on the chart.
attrs.name: labelSepChar

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description:
Sets whether the `clickURL` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when the chart is clicked) overrides the `link` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when a data plot is clicked). 

Default value: 0 (`clickURL` does not override `link`)
attrs.name: clickURLOverridesPlotLinks

attrs.description: Uses the same data plot color for data labels.
attrs.name: useDataPlotColorForLabels

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description:
This attribute lets you enable/disable the highlight effect, in the form of a `fadeout`, for the data plots corresponding to a legend item. When this attribute is enabled and the mouse pointer is hovered over a legend item label, plots belonging to the other data series fadeout, by reducing their opacity.

 The fadeout effect can be customized by specifying the fadeout color and opacity using the `color` and `alpha` attributes. Eg. `fadeout|color=#ff0000, alpha=60`
attrs.name: plotHighlightEffect

attrs.description: Whether to show "Print Chart" item in the context menu of the chart? Even if you opt to hide the item in context menu, you can still opt to invoke `print()` JavaScript method of the chart to print the same.
attrs.name: showPrintMenuItem

attrs.description: This attribute changes the theme of the chart. There are 7 types of themes which have been made according to the different color combinations.
attrs.name: theme

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show/hide data labels, data values etc. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels). Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like Caption, sub-caption etc.), you'll need to use the Styles feature of FusionCharts XT. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc.

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: labelFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: labelFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: labelFontSize

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be bold or not.
attrs.name: labelFontBold

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be italicized or not.
attrs.name: labelFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
attrs.name: labelAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
attrs.name: labelBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
attrs.name: labelBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
attrs.name: labelBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
attrs.name: labelBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
attrs.name: labelBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around x-axis labels should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: labelBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets a link for every data plot label.
attrs.name: labelLink

attrs.description: Enables the use of pattern fills at global level.
attrs.name: usePattern

attrs.description: Set the type of pattern, possible values are: `circle`, `square`, and `line`. The default value is `line`
attrs.name: patternType

attrs.description: Set the angle of the pattern fill in degrees. The default value is 40 for lines and 0 for circle and square.
attrs.name: patternAngle

attrs.description: Set the density of pattern fill shapes in pixels. The default value is 6.
attrs.name: patternDensity

attrs.description:
Set the size of the pattern fill shape.

It sets the thickness of lines, the default value is 2.
It sets the diameter of circles, the default value is 4.
It sets the length of squares, the default value is 4.
attrs.name: patternSize

attrs.description: Sets the color of pattern shapes in 6-digit hex color notation, by default it inherits values from `paletteColors`.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Set the opacity of pattern shapes in %. The default value is 100.
attrs.name: patternAlpha

attrs.description: Set the background color for pattern fills in 6-digit hex color notation.
attrs.name: patternBgColor

attrs.description: Set the padding for the label.
attrs.name: labelPadding

attrs.description: Use this attribute to show or hide the context label.
attrs.name: showContextLabel

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label which will be displayed.
attrs.name: defaultContextLabel

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label text which will be displayed.
attrs.name: contextLabelText

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label font style.
attrs.name: contextLabelFont

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label font size.
attrs.name: contextLabelFontSize

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label font size.
attrs.name: contextLabelFontColor

attrs.description: Use this attribute to specify the context label opacity.
attrs.name: contextLabelAlpha

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showLabel

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of all data labels of the chart.

attrs.description: Whether to show legend on the chart.
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Whether legend keys should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend item font
attrs.name: legendItemFont

attrs.description: Sets legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color
attrs.name: legendItemFontColor

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color on hover
attrs.name: legendItemHoverFontColor

attrs.description: The legend can be plotted at different positions with respect to the chart. Note that if the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, you also need to set the coordinates of the legend. You can do that using the attributes `legendXPosition` and `legendYPosition`, both of which accept absolute or percentage values.
attrs.range: bottom, right, top, top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right, left, left-top, left-bottom, right, right-top, right-bottom, and absolute
attrs.name: legendPosition

attrs.description: When the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, use this attribute to set the X-coordinate of the legend. It accepts absolute or percentage values. By default, its value is set to `0`.
attrs.name: legendXPosition

attrs.description: When the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, use this attribute to set the Y-coordinate of the legend. It accepts absolute or percentage values. By default, its value is set to `0`.
attrs.name: legendYPosition

attrs.description: Sets the number of rows the legend should display.
attrs.name: legendNumRows

attrs.description: Sets the number of columns the legend should display.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Sets the legend caption horizontal alignment .
attrs.name: legendCaptionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether legend caption should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font
attrs.name: legendCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font size
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font color
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.
attrs.name: legendCaption

attrs.description: Sets the color that applies on both text font and icon when they are in a  disabled / hidden state
attrs.name: legendItemHiddenColor

attrs.description: Scaling of legend icon is possible in FusionCharts XT. This attribute lets you control the size of the legend icon. The default scale value is 1. Anything less than 1 reduces the size of the legend-icons on the chart. Any value bigger than 1 enlarges the icons. e.g., 0.5 means half the size, where as, 2 means twice the size.
attrs.name: legendIconScale

attrs.description: Background color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgColor

attrs.description: Background alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgAlpha

attrs.description: Border Color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a shadow for legend.
attrs.name: legendShadow

attrs.description: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.
attrs.name: legendAllowDrag

attrs.description: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.
attrs.name: legendScrollBgColor

attrs.description: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: reverseLegend

attrs.description: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a particular legend key, the associated slice slides out from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the slice to slide in.
attrs.name: interactiveLegend

attrs.description: The legend items are arranged in columns. Using this attribute, you can propose the number of columns. This value undergoes internal checking on judicious use of white-space. In case, the value is found improper, the chart auto-calculates the number of columns. When set to 0, the chart automatically decides the number of columns. The above is applicable when `legendPosition` is set to BOTTOM`.` If you have set RIGHT `legendPosition`, the number of columns is always set to 1.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
attrs.name: minimiseWrappingInLegend

attrs.description:
Specifies whether drawing a custom legend icon will be enabled. All legend icon customization attributes will work only if this feature is enabled. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
attrs.name: drawCustomLegendIcon

attrs.description:
Sets the border color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot border color
attrs.name: legendIconBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the background color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot fill color
attrs.name: legendIconBgColor

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon background transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the number of sides for the legend icon. 

Default value: 4
attrs.name: legendIconSides

attrs.description:
Sets the thickness of the legend icon border. 

Default value: 1
attrs.name: legendIconBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets the starting angle of for drawing the legend icon. 

Default value: 45
attrs.name: legendIconStartAngle

attrs.description: This attribute if set to `0`, the legend box will be center aligned with respect to the entire width of the chart only if the total width of the legend box is more than the canvas width. By default, the legend box is center aligned with respect to the canvas width and it remains the same if the width of the legend box is less than the canvas width.
attrs.name: alignLegendWithCanvas

description: In Radial Bar charts, the name of each bar shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide the same. Also, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of the chart. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the inner radius of the chart. FusionCharts XT automatically calculates the best fit radius for the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values. Starting v3.14.0, you can specify the radius of a doughnut chart in both percentage and pixel values.
attrs.name: innerRadius

attrs.description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the outer radius of the chart. FusionCharts XT automatically calculates the best fit radius for the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values. Starting v3.14.0, you can specify the radius of a doughnut chart in both percentage and pixel values.
attrs.name: outerRadius

attrs.description: By default, the Radial Bar chart starts from angle 90 degrees. If you want to change the starting angle of the chart, use this attribute. It obeys the conventions of co-ordinate geometry where 0 degrees means hand of a clock at 3. Starting angle Increases anti-clockwise.
attrs.name: startAngle

attrs.description: By default, the Radial Bar chart end from angle 180 degrees. If you want to change the starting angle of the chart, use this attribute. It obeys the conventions of co-ordinate geometry where 0 degrees means hand of a clock at 3. Starting angle Increases anti-clockwise.
attrs.name: endAngle

attrs.description: Controls and enforces the space between the bars and tracks.
attrs.name: trackPadding

attrs.description: Controls and enforces the space between the bars. The default value will be 6px.
attrs.name: trackMargin

attrs.description: Modifies the radius of the track corners at the start.
attrs.name: trackStartRadius

attrs.description: Modifies the radius of the track corners at the end.
attrs.name: trackEndRadius

attrs.description: Modifies the radius of the bar's corner at the start.
attrs.name: barStartRadius

attrs.description: Modifies the radius of the bar's corner at the end.
attrs.name: barEndRadius

attrs.description: Sets the opacity for the bars. Default is set to 100%.
attrs.name: barAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the opacity for the tracks. Default is set to 40%.
attrs.name: trackAlpha

attrs.description: Set at the data level so that individual plot colors could be configured.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Set at both chart and data level. If set on chart level then it should be applied to all the tracks.
attrs.name: trackFillColor

attrs.description: Sets the border for the tracks. Default is set to none.
attrs.name: trackBorder

attrs.description: Sets the border for the bars. Default is set to none.
attrs.name: barBorder

attrs.description: Configure the color of the track border.
attrs.name: trackBorderColor

attrs.description: Configure the color of the bar border.
attrs.name: barBorderColor

attrs.description: Configure the opacity for the track border.
attrs.name: trackBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Configure the opacity for the bar border.
attrs.name: barBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Configure the thickness for the track's border.
attrs.name: trackBorderThickness

attrs.description: Configure the thickness for the bar's border.
attrs.name: barBorderThickness

description: The following attributes let you control various functionalities of the Radial Bar chart.

attrs.description: Set the URL of the icon you want to render.
attrs.name: icon

attrs.description: Configure wether to show or hide the labels for the icons.
attrs.name: showLabelIcon

attrs.description: Place icon inside or outside chart.
attrs.name: placeValueInside

attrs.description: Use this attribute to increase or decrease the label icon size.
attrs.name: iconScale

attrs.description: Use this attribute to select the icon's position.
attrs.name: iconPosition

description: The following attributes let you control the icon functionalities of the Radial Bar chart.

attrs.description: Choose the number for the ticks.
attrs.name: numTicks

attrs.description: Choose the show or hide the tick values.
attrs.name: showTickValues

attrs.description: Selects the font for the tick's value.
attrs.name: tickValueLabelFont

attrs.description: Select the tick's value font size.
attrs.name: tickValueFontSize

attrs.description: Select the tick's value font color.
attrs.name: tickValueFontColor

attrs.description: Select the tick's value font color.
attrs.name: tickValueAlpha

attrs.description: Choose to display or to hide tick marks.
attrs.name: showTickMarks

attrs.description: Specify the lenght of tick marks.
attrs.name: tickMarkLenght

attrs.description: Specify the thickness of tick marks.
attrs.name: tickMarkThickness

attrs.description: Specify the opacity of tick marks.
attrs.name: tickAlpha

attrs.description: Specify the opacity of tick mark's value.
attrs.name: tickValueAlpha

attrs.description: Choose the tick mark color.
attrs.name: tickMarkColor

description: The following attributes let you control the tick functionalities of the Radial Bar chart.

attrs.description: Whether to show tool tip on chart.
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the border transparency for tool tip.
attrs.name: tooltipBorderAlpha

attrs.description: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipSepChar

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tool-tips on the chart.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description:
Specify custom text for the tooltip 

 You can either specify a constant string as the tooltip text or you can use variable values from the data level by prefixing a __$__ to the attribute name, for example, __$name__, __$value__.
attrs.name: plottooltext

attrs.description: Configure the tooltip's position.
attrs.name: tooltipPosition

description: These attributes let you control the tool tip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.
